title: How can Google Calendar be improved? - Quora
tags: How Can X Consumer Internet Product Be Improved?

response.answer_text: I had been using the Google Calendar since last 2 years after having trial and errors with few other 3rd party apps promising deliverables of sync, backup, desktop collaboration and just like that. A calendar, plus an organizer with a to-do list, everything compiles in this app from G.Suite. I had this trouble once of mistakenly deleting events which got sorted with the feature trash encompassed in later updates of the app. All was good until today when erroneously on my repeating event, the click went on to “All Events” which ideally should have been on “This Event” only. (Attached screenshot).  And lo! Boasting of big reliance, data sync, and tons of whole lot of features, this thing just ruined it. In a kind of Thanos snap'. All my journal entries, memoirs and everyday thinking just whooosh. Duplicated into the entry of today, and copy-pasted retrospective, and forward events too. Damn!!! Foolish coders out there. . . Can't just have an undo edit option??? The calendar app version while I write on my Android 9 now is . . .  The fact of surprise, though these people have the undo-edits feature on their notes app, Google Keep, they are lazy enough to can't incorporate in their calendar app. The undo-edits in Google Keep:  Hope any update in due time lets me recover the lost data of 2 years. . . If not, this app sucks! Try other 3rd party apps out there. They maybe intruding your data, but are good than this big data fool giant Google!

I would love to be able to import other CalDAV or ical calendars. So Google calendar would work both as a Calendar Server and as a client. Many people have some enterprise calendar server and a private google calendar (or other scenarios, with two jobs/responsibilities, only one of them running google calendar).I would be nice to be able to embed a 'common events calendar' or something alike into google sites (or somewhere else). Of course you can easily embed a read-only calendar now. But collaborative editing a common-events calendar (e.g. events of interest to all members of an goolge-app installation) is quite a pain, because peole click on the widget, their own calendar opens, than they have to manually add this other calendar and if they create a new event, they have to choose the right calendar. We are running google-apps and people do only use the common calendar, they do not use their own calendar.

The biggest improvement for me would be to reinstate the functionality to allow you to accept invites to your alternate address, your email alias.  Say you get an invite to you@yourdomain.com that forwards to you@gmail.com, before April this year if you accepted that invite, all would be done. Now, google calendar rejects the invite forcing you to use your gmail address. Frustrating when you use gmail to consolidate email from other addresses! Google do propose a clunky work around setting up another calendar is the alternate name, but it is awkward to say the least. See: http://www.google.com/support/forum/p/Calendar/thread?tid=2dcfda2de638b884&hl=en

It would be great to be able to add a default guest to all new events that have resources attached to them. How this is being used: We have a master calendar for all the rooms (resources) that are in use. We created a user with the email rooms@domain.com to hold this as their default calendar. In order for the event to be populated on this master calendar, the creator of the event must invite rooms@domain.com We did this as a way of holding all the resource calendars in one place. The problem with this solution is that people forget to put rooms@domain.com as a guest every time they check out a room. This may be a convoluted workaround in itself. Ultimately, it would be nice to have a way to better track who is using what resources at any given time.

Adding a Doodle-alike (http://doodle.com) extension that would allow you to suggest times for a potential meeting to potential participants. It would base those times off of your schedule, but allow customization like recursion only (so it would make the potential times based off of whether you can make the time again and again in the future). Google means both email and calendar, so it needs to integrate these.

Having FYI functionality as well as participants. Of course, right now you can invite participants but there are occasions where you simply want to let someone know you’re on top of things. Adding an FYI field would be useful as it would send a message, not an invite, to a manager, colleague or spouse to advise that you have taken care of an issue you may have discussed.

Be great if google calendar remembered the people I have invited to events previously. Currently (as of Dec 2012) it seems the only way this is available is if your invitee is in one of your circles.  suggested improvements:feature one: Add guests to contacts automaticallyfeature two: For future events, recall those guests in email field auto-complete  feature three: Add a link to your contacts from the Add Guests form cluster.feature four: Add help text/icon that provides guidance and FAQs.

I would like to see some integration between Google Calendar and Mail where there's an option when creating events to automate a G-chat status change. For example, when I create a meeting event on Calendar at 10 AM, I'd like it so that at 10 AM, my Google Apps chat status turns from green/available to red/"In a meeting". Often times at our company, we forget to change our statuses on chat and will receive incoming chats during meetings (when we can't respond until afterwards).

Please include more basic events. There's a Dentist flair, but not one for Doctor or Vet. I can Clean House, but there's nothing for Grocery shopping. There's nothing for Payday, Bills or Laundry. I go to a lot of work Meetings, but that flair doesn't show up. These should have been added years ago. The App is old enough that improvements should have automatically shown up each year. I hope someone finally adjusts it. Thanks.
Make the 'Tasks' Calendar shareable (including write-access). Therefore allowing others (like your boss) to assign you tasks.
Enabling the mobile sync for Tasks in Calendar.
The biggest improvement would be to make search work for Google Calendar.  See this question for more details: How could Google allow Google Calendar search to be broken for more than two years?
I need the ability to search for events and then to mark/delete several events at once. Works well in Gmail, why not in Calendar?
Improve the integration with iCal so that all my gCal's dont show up as 'delegates'. Also simple group calendars, proper.
I'd like to see categories of events with a color assigned to each category
